header.title: RedBar³
header.description: Places a links/navigation bar along the top and bottom of your forums which can be easily updated via the ACP
header.author-notes: This is a remake of my phpBB2 MOD - please note that I will not be providing an upgrade path from the phpBB2 version to phpBB3.

action-group.diy-instructions:
Go to your ACP -> System -> Module Management :: Administration Control Panel. At the botom of that page, type RedBar in the text box and then click "Create New Module" Under module enabled, select "yes" and click submit. Click in the module you just created.
Now, next to the "Add Module" button, click the dropdown and look for/select "RedBar³ Configuration" Now click "Add Module" and Yes on the confirmation screen. Click enable to enable the module. Refresh the page - you might need to purge your cache / empty your temp files, but an extra tab should be available now. You will also have to set permissions for who can manage the links. This is done in the ACP: Users & Groups - Groups Permissions - Select Group - Admin Permissions - Misc Tab - 'Can manage RedBar Links'
Lastly, don't forget to purge your cache after making these edits!
